medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute-onset right upper quadrant (RUQ) pain and emesis.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient experienced band-like epigastric pain that moved to the RUQ after eating cookies at 9pm, which awoke him in the middle of the night. The pain is constant, intensifies in waves, and he has had 2 episodes of non-bilious, non-bloody emesis. He reports never having had pain like this before. Zofran was administered without improvement. The patient denies fever or chills, diarrhea, or flank pain.
medical_history.past_medical_history: End-stage renal disease (ESRD), contrast nephropathy, poorly-controlled type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM), coronary artery disease (CAD) status post coronary artery bypass grafting (CABG) and aortic valve replacement (AVR), history of peripheral artery disease (PAD) with multiple toe amputations, osteomyelitis of the right metatarsal head requiring debridement, and diagnosed with diabetic retinopathy and head trauma.
medical_history.family_history: Paternal grandmother with diabetes mellitus; father with myocardial infarction.
